diamin

Class BioGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • diamin.BioGraph

  • public class BioGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    The BioGraph class models in a Java application the concept of a MIN partitioned among different workers of a Spark Cluster.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BioGraph(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext jsc, org.graphframes.GraphFrame MIN)

      Returns the closeness returns the closeness of an input interactor.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> closestComponent(java.lang.String S)
      Returns the connected component of the underlying graph, containing the largest number of elements in common with an input subset of interactors.
      java.util.ArrayList<scala.Tuple2<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer>> degrees(int n)
      Returns the list of interactors of the underlying graph, with their associated degree.
      float density()
      Returns the density index of the underlying graph.
      long interactionCounter()
      Returns the number of interactions (i.e., the edges) of the underlying graph.
      void interactions(java.lang.String filename)
      Writes on an external text file the unique id or the name of all interactions (i.e., edges) of the underlying graph
      void interactors(java.lang.String filename)
      Writes on an external text file the unique id or the name of all the interactors (i.e., the nodes) of the underlying graph.
      long interactorsCounter()
      Returns the number of interactors of the underlying graph.
      java.util.ArrayList<scala.Tuple2<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> intersectionByComponent(java.lang.String S)
      For each distinct connected component of the underlying graph, returns its unique id number and the size of its intersection with an input subset of interactors.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> xNeighbors(java.lang.String S, int x)
      Returns the x-neighbors of a subset of interactors
      BioGraph xSubgraph(java.lang.String S, int x)
      Returns the subgraph containing a subset of interactors and their x-neighbors.

      Returns the x-weighted-neighborhood of an input interactor.
      BioGraph xWeightedSubgraph(java.lang.String i, int x)
      Returns the subgraph containing an input interactor and its x-weighted-neighbors.
